title: Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area, Las Vegas
address: 3205 Nevada 159, Las Vegas, NV 89161
review_list:
Awesome scenery. Relaxing ride. We even saw so e wild burros. Great photo op. I still love looking at those rock formations.

Very nice combination of colors in the mountains. It feels like being at the grand canyon just 10 minutes from urban Vegas.
The calico tanks is the place to go, but don't stop there, just a few more feet above, you will find the best view of the entire city.

Amazing experience driving the loop and hiking some trails. Only had half a day so had to choose trails. You have to spend some time at the first stop in Callico Hills for the amazing red rocks. You really can't go wrong with any of them. Most of the people are just there for the pictures so once you get...


More  



WoW! only 30 minutes from Las Vegas, but it feels like a whole other world!
The conservation center was GREAT! and gave us plenty of hiking options.
*heads up* the "Discovery" walk for children (hike #8), while it's short... is NOT friendly. It requires sturdy shoes and the ability to climb steep trails and pieces of rock. The waterfall is...


More  



We did the Turtlehead Peak trail. Strenuous indeed, but managed the ascent and descent in 2.5 hours including stops. The views from the peak are great across the canyon and over the whole of Las Vegas.

Did the moderate hike with our 7 and 8 year old children. Bring hiking shoes, long pants, lwater snacks and a jacket as it gets from hot to cold very quickly within the trail.

this was wonderful we drove thru the canyon and it was very pretty we stopped at most of the pull offs and took pictures

We spent a while in the museum and outside area before beginning the driving tour. Did not see enough. We spent an hour there, but wanted to go on the drive around. Beautiful area and so nice to have comfortable stops with tables for a picnic. Did not hike, but had a wonderful afternoon outing.

It is a different place. Not that all may like it but it is worth visiting.
You will see the nature's beauty in plenty

Beautiful nature, close to Las Vegas. Amazing colors, easy to drive. Enjoyed the views and were able to make great pictures.

title: Conservatory & Botanical Gardens at Bellagio, Las Vegas
address: Bellagio, 3600 Las Vegas Blvd., Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
It smelt soooo good in there! I wanted to stay in the conservatory all day! When we went they had the 6 Chinese children all made of flowers.

We went and saw this it was cool, butterflies landed on me. Smells so great in the garden and its nice and warm.

We love to visit this free attraction during the different seasons of the year. The live flowers are beautiful and there are several places to take great selfies. This is another must see free thing in Las Vegas. Absolutely breathtaking. Take pictures but realize they will never be as amazing as seeing it first hand.

I absolutely loved walking around the conservatory, we were there just after Chinese New Year and the display was stunning. Definitely worth the effort to go in and have a little walk around. It still felt peaceful despite it being quite busy

This is a spectacular array of flowers and the aroma is unforgettable. The display of so many exotic floral arrangements and such a well maintained display is very refreshing to observe in a hotel setting. They seem to always keep the theme based on the time of the year so it is spectacular any month of the year. I was...

These gardens are usually dressed in some theme. This time it was the Chinese new year. They had oranges and monkeys everywhere. This is located in the lobby and is changed seasonally. It was decorated in the Chineese New Year decorations. Very nice

In the middle of the blazing Las Vegas desert the Wynn Casino stands out, the main reason is the stunning waterfalls. Grab a table and a couple of drinks and just relax. The negative ions are washed away, and I always feel refreshed and chill by the time I leave.

Beautiful display of garden, a bit similar to Bellagio when we visited. But not as busy as Bellagio, so it's more peaceful and relaxing.

the strip is full of action and wonderful to see too much for just one visit so many places to see and shop the casinos are all decorated so differently and the action rides there is something for everyone on the strip

every moment can be enjoyed, so keep walking slowly

title: High Roller, Las Vegas

review_list:
Looking at the Las Vegas lights from the wheel is truly unforgettable. Wonderful 360 degree views, comfortable even for someone who does not like heights.

address: 300 Stewart Avenue, Las Vegas, NV 89101
review_list:
We took some of our out of town visitors to see the Mob Museum and it was truly a treat. There is so much history of the old Las Vegas and the influence the Mob made on it. Very interesting.

This is a great place to take a break from the norm in Vegas. Very interesting and also put the side of the "good guys" across rather than just glamorising the usual suspects. Made us laugh when we saw an exhibit at the end having a pop at Sepp Blatter and FIFA !

History lovers and those that are interested in mobster folklore will love this place. The Mob Museum is awesome. They exhibits are interactive, to the point of even a hologram court room reenactment, but not so flashy that it takes away from all the history and information you can learn. It's the perfect blend. Highly recommended and not to be missed.

The museum is loaded with incredible history covering the Mob and Law Enforcement. It was a real eye opener and a fantastic couple of hours. so worth the visit.

The mob museum is well worth a visit, very interesting just take your time and take it all in, very knowledgeable staff

This was the first place we went to see when we arrived to Vegas. Its a great building and the museum did not disappoint. The staff was very helpful with information and guiding us through the museum. You have to go to the souvenir shop.

title: Hoover Dam Bypass, Las Vegas
address: U.S. Route 93, Las Vegas, NV
review_list:
I never imagined what I was at the Hoover Dam until I was there. Absolutely astounding. If you are ever out that way I do highly suggest seeing this!

This is beautiful, definitely take the time to get a view of the dam. This is beautiful we have done it twice now.

We could take beautiful pictures, and the walk by parking in the restaurant area was good. It was a nice experience.

It`s the best and more complete view of the Hoover Dam. You just have to climb a couple of stairs. Be careful in the warmer months, it gets really hot and dry. Drink plenty of water!!

If you find yourself in the area of the Hoover Dam Bypass--take it. The view is spectacular and the view of the dam and some incredible construction make this a must see attraction.

flypast hoover dam along the heli flight to grand canyon. its huge, though looks small from the heli. featured in transformers

Take the old road out to the dam and do the obligatory park and walk for the photo session, but the ByPass beckons for your return.

defiantly worth the stop if you;re already passing through....be sure to also visit hoover dam museum & take the Hard Hat Tour (about $22) while you're there...

title: Stratosphere Tower, Las Vegas
address: 2000 Las Vegas Blvd S, Stratosphere Casino Hotel & Tower, Las Vegas, NV 89104
review_list:
OK I'll be blunt... The tower looks a little run down in places. This didn't bother me... But for some reason other visitors had something to say about it. The tower itself is a must see and the view it gives you of Las Vegas is simply amazing.

Good food and one of a kind view. The prices are a bit high, but you are paying for the view. Saw the jumpers and the ride up top from the restaurant. Go at Sunset.

Easy to reach there. After going there if we do not visit we will miss. You can see the whole of City and it is really a good experience

The view is breathtaking. I did the insanity and the extreme rides. It's like I was tempting fate by doing them but it was totally worth it. The names are just what they are Extreme and Insanity. Definitely one of my best experiences in Las Vegas . Totally loved it.

The stratosphere is a really fun place to go. The view is fantastic and the rides are a little daring. On the observation level you can walk all the way around and enjoy a 360 degree view of the strip and the Vegas valley. It's well worth visiting.

Kept me on the end of my seat! The set changes were amazing! Talented actors and actresses! The aerials were awesome! We really enjoyed the show!

title: Casino at Bellagio, Las Vegas
address: 3600 Las Vegas Boulevard South, Bellagio, Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
one of the best casinos in las vegas...but the tables can be a bit higher at certain times..anyway if you are in vegas you know you will have to spent money:)

This casino is one of my absolute favorites on the strip. Everything is well laid out, the slots seem to give me better luck and the entire building is just beautiful! Be sure to stop on your way in and check out the water show, it runs all evening and is well worth your time before you head in to...


More  



Found the same action as the other casinos. Didn't win a darn thing! For some reason we thought the casinos in Vegas might be a bit looser than other places. Boy were we foolish.

nice casino has all the bells & whistles of course very luxuries place & its huge the shopping is not for those on a budget

The casino at Bellagio is one of nicest in Vegas, its well laid out with great lighting and awesome air flow that keeps the air feeling and smelling fresh. There are small bars surrounding it so never have to go far for a refreshment or snack. Overall the casino is part of great hotel

Some of my favorite slots are here. I can also find less smokey areas that have my favorite slots. When I am done playing slots I visit the conservatory or get a gelato at the place near the art gallery. They now have a free tram that runs from Monte Carlo to Bellagio.

The place is one of the cleanest, tables rage (depending on time of day) $15 to what ever you want to spend. The atrium is updated quarterly and is always beautiful. Then you can watch the fountain when you need a break, its every 15 minutes.

Bellagio is one of the main reason's Las Vegas is such an amazing place to visit. My husband and I enjoy the water show and could just watch it all evening long. The Hotel itself is also beautiful and although pricey to stay overnight. While in Vegas walking thru Bellagio is a MUST thing to do and its free!

The Casino at the Bellagio is pretty and very well designed. The air conditioning does a great job of filtering out the smoke and the best thing about it is that you're left alone. The staff are there to serve you unlike other casino's where they try and upsell you anything and everything,

This casino is something special. The bellagio is a tough hotel/resort to beat but the casino brings it all into perspective. It has a very high end feeling with several sections of tables and a ton of machines.

title: The Grand Canal Shoppes at The Venetian, Las Vegas
address: 3377 Las Vegas Blvd South, Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
The Grand Canal and Shoppes are hands down the best I've ever been to. The theme is fantastic and so well done, it's clean, it's perfectly maintained and very cool offering a much needed break from not only the heat but the gambling.
I

Love the shops here. Nice and comfortable environment with lots of choices. The rooms are nice and spacious but for this much money, it should have coffee in the rooms.

I went to Venice in 2014 so going here was super fun! It was so cute how it's set up so much like Venice actually is! We stopped in to shop at Pandora and have some gelato. Go check it out! It's the next best thing to actually being there!

I love Venezia! Although I did enjoy my time in Venice, Italy, I missed out on the Carnival of Venice. The gift shops at The Venetian in Las Vegas had on display a variety of carnival masks. I love the mask I bought before taking the gondola ride. Walking through the shops reminded me of the real Venice- lots of...

What an amazing place they have built here, the painting on the ceiling is done very well ( blue sky with clouds) it's looks so realistic. We went for a walk down it a Couple of times , it's very relaxing.

This is the most amazing place. You forget you are inside, the ceiling is a painted sky, there is a canal with gondolas, strolling entertainers and lots of shops. You can spend the day, but be sure to spend a couple of hours.
You would never know you were inside, it's not smoky, it actually smells like fresh air.

I tend to visit this place everytime I'm in Las Vegas. I love the artificial sky and always feel like I would be walking outside in open air directly aside the Canals.. it's perfect how they managed the sky to look natural - just wonderful! Absolutely a must when you visit Las Vegas!

The Shoppes at Venetian is where you find a nice range of brand name retail shops, eateries in an indoor themed area which resembles the canals and squares of Venice, Italy. Shops opening hours are approximately 11am to 10pm daily.
We recently passed by and enjoyed seeing the Chinese New Year displays set up for the upcoming holiday season. While...

title: Mount Charleston, Las Vegas
address: Robbers Roost Trail, Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
I've been training at Mt Charleston for the last 5-6 years. It is easily 25 to 30 degrees cooler on an average than the strip, Tried running early on the strip like a lot of people do or at the track at UNLV but found Mt Charleston better and more accessible. I usually take 3 or 4 days, 10 miles...


More  



I seem to remember that the start of the hike from the road up to the Robber's Roost cave is approximately 6000' and you hike up approximately another 1000'. This is not for the out-of-shape but you don't need to be a mountain climber either! Take your time and enjoy the flora and fauna and wonderful clean air.

30 minutes outside of Las Vegas is a great mountain range with hiking trails and camp grounds. The lodge is a nice spot to stop at the end of your day. A place to get away from the city.

This Florida couple couldn't get up to the mountain fast enough! No joke, we got off the plane, got to the resort, rented a car and went to the mountain! During the winter months, check the advisories before heading up. We had to have either chains or 4 wheel drive. We got lucky and Enterprise had a 4 wheel Jeep...


More  



We were so surprised to see the difference of the nature on our way to go there. From the desert at Vegas to a mountain with green threes and a place to ski, we found that so great!!! I didn't expected a place like that near Vegas, so, it's was very nice to go there. I recommended it so much!

We have been here before with my sister and my Dad came along this trip. He was in complete surprise when we got there. The views are so amazing we did not want to leave. There was snow on the mountains, most amazing views. Ate at the restaurant sitting by the fire bit overlooking the mountains. Food was actually really...


More  



Enlightened me to more of LasVegas and probably the residents activities. A nice drive and there was snow and many sledders enjoying.

We drove up to Mount Charleston for a day trip. There was about a foot of snow on the ground, and kids (big & small) were sledding everywhere. It was beautiful!
The locals said that the temps are always 15-20 degrees cooler than Las Vegas, so even in the Summer, it would make a nice trip up the mountain.

Just the drive to and from Mt. Charleston is absolutely stunning!
I like to go there during Dec/Jan when theres snow. Beautiful scenic drive. Once you get to the top, theres a 24 hr. restaurant with great food. and a wood burning furnace inside which keeps you warm and fuzzy. Its just a great place to visit every year.

The first time we went up Mt. Charleston, we were blown away. You don't expect to find pine forest and cool temperatures just outside of Las Vegas! Great hiking, great shops, just a totally different experience.

a very nice way to spend some hours gambling in a classy environment no cheep bets but well worth the experience

title: Shelby American, Inc., Las Vegas
address: 6405 Ensworth Street, Las Vegas, NV 89129
review_list:
If you are a Shelby Mustang fan or just a car enthusiast this is a must see! The location is south of the strip off of Las Vegas Blvd on Sunset. It's about a $15 cab ride from the Luxor. The tour is offered only twice a day with the last tour at 1:30 so plan accordingly.

We took the daily tour and learned many stories about the legend, Carroll Shelby. We saw many amazing cars including a $24 million one. Fun stop over with many great finds in the the gift shop. Staff is eager to share stories and help in any way. Very close to the Vegas Strip too.

Never pass up a free attraction in Vegas that the entire family can enjoy. I recommend taking the morning tour so you can go into the shop and watch employees working on vehicles. (You don't get to go into the shop if you take the afternoon tour). Our guide was not only very knowledgeable, but also personally knew Carroll Shelby....


More  



Had the full Shelby experience and loved it! Our tour guide was amazing and didnt leave out any possible information you could imagine. If he did there was a Q&A after. I would highly recommend this attraction next time in LV if you have any interest in cars at all.

I think this is a hidden gem. If you like auto racing or fast cars or maybe you're just a car enthusiast, you'll probably LOVE this stop. If you're doubtful on this, consider that there is no admission charge.
The building houses a museum of Shelby Cobras, Shelby Mustangs, and other Shelby cars but it's also the Shelby factory. You...

We had a group of Ford and Shelby lovers and others not so much, however everyone all ages enjoyed the facility. The staff are very friendly. Come and pay homage to Carroll Shelby and his wonderful creations. The tour is free, informative, and well worth it.

My boys loved this FREE museum! There are many Cobras and a few other Shelby cars to gaze on. This is a free, self guided tour. The gift shop has some great unique Shelby items.
If you like cars of any kind - I recommend this tour. We had fun!

Got there just as the free tour was starting. Many of Shelby's classics and some new cars too. Got to go in the shop, see what was being worked on.

Although much smaller and intimate than the strip, this place always is fun especially after the sun goes down. People watching, gambling, food, inexpensive rooms. something for everyone

just find a good location to watch, sit back, relax enjoy the perect show of water..if you are staying in bellagio ask for a room with the fountain views

It is must see show in Vegas. It has a great combination of water, lights and music. If you can, stand around the hotel and enjoy the nice background of lights from the Hotel/Casinos across the street.

The building is very fun and cool. Lots of fun games like War. Very clean and drinks will cost a bit but worth the visit.

great novelty stores, good food at good prices, stuff for children to do, eclectic mix of stores, something for everyone here

title: The Gallery at Aria, Las Vegas

review_list:
Who knew Vegas was such a hot spot for Chihuly glass sightings! First happened upon his work at the Bellagio, then at the Mirage. This was like visiting a mini Chihuly museum.

Most of what I love about Las Vegas has nothing to do with gambling. It's the art and design - with some installations so grand that wonder where such things could come from. Aria's exhibit is no exception to the rule.

This is very high end shopping. It's really fun to stroll thru the beautiful stores.
Just looking doesn't cost anything.

Very nice shops in gorgeous Aria's shopping pavilion: big variety, if you have big bucks to spend - have a blast!

A must see when you are in Las Vegas. So many beautiful things to look at. I just kept going back to look again. No need to rush through. Well worth a nice relaxing stroll.

This glass sculpting is pretty and interesting, but not really my thing. Definitely make a stop if you're into 3-D art or general art, but skip it if not.

Beautiful art work to see for free. There are some sculptures also with some prints and painting. It is all free and indoors that is the best thing about it

The Gallery is eyecatching and to be honest, I'm not an art lover and don't know how to appreciate the art but as soon I had a look on it, I said wow, lovely.

The Art is amazing and even if you are not an art lover, you will find pieces that catch your eye! The hotel itself is trendy and beautiful, stayed there last summer.

The gallery row is located off the strip and it's nice for the stroll to visit the exhibits. I loved the photographs, blow glass and the bronze statues.

The museum was really well put together and I especially liked that there was information about the cultural and environmental effects of the tests. I was pleased that the museum also had an exhibit specifically about Native American land use before the tests were conducted.
The information targeted all levels, from those who have a passing interest to those with...

Really enjoyed this historical museum with interesting, good displays. Learned a lot about atomic testing that was done in the nearby area.

title: Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood, Las Vegas
address: 3667 S. Las Vegas Blvd., Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
The only benefit to this place is it allows you to escape Vegas. They don't allow the hustlers and street vendors inside which allows you a few minutes to enjoy not being harassed. But the shopping is just what you'd find anywhere else.

Great place to shop, located right in the middle of the strip near everything. Many shops ranging from average to very high end. Something for everyone! Has a food court and easily can access the Planet Hollywood casino. There is always something going on on the strip right outside too!

Lots of your average shops with a few boutiques some good eating places, we found a mexican bar where we had breakfast, they also sold cold marguertias which were lovely too. Half way through the mile you get a fake sky and some arabic looking buildings, it is certainly worth a visit

Good array of shops with everything you could dream of (except Michael Kors). Clean, open late, pretty good service in all shops we entered.

Based within Planet Hollywood Hotel, the Miracle Mile Shops has loads of more lower end shops (not like Gucci etc) which makes it more comfortable to walk around. Very clean and several café/coffee shops and restaurants including one of our favourites, Earl of Sandwich which is just amazing for some lunch or breakfast.
Definitely worth having a walk around.

My wife and I spent the better part of two days shopping the multitude of stores in the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood. We found her the perfect boutique purse that I ended up buying for her 29th wedding anniversary gift, along with a complementary necklace.
We also dined at a couple of restaurants inside, saw two great Vegas...

This in an indoor shopping mall with an indoor street feeling - nice decor. Worth wandering through to see the setting as well as to browse the shops. Some reasonably priced nice eateries here too. Accessed off the Strip via Planet Hollywood & Paris hotels.

This was a great place to walk around. It also has a 24-hr Buffalo Wild Wings. A great little highlight of shopping on the strip.

a super large casino to fitt all budgets large poker school / tournaments everyday with a budget to fit everyone's pockets

great ride! has a loop and a cork screw. make sure you line up for the front carriage once you get on the platform. it worth it.

We like the Colorado Cafe there - that has 103 different items to choose from...... we went there twice... and we were staying in downtown Vegas off the strip.

review_list:

The meal given was as though you live in the Medieval Times. We were given a huge bird to eat. We were seated in steps too view the show. The show was magnificent with glitz, glare, lights, fire, noise, and an astounding performance with the knights on horses.

Great food and so much fun, exciting story,fireworks, explosions,fire, horse's & a battle between good & evil

This show is a must when visiting Las Vegas. Not only do you watch a show, but you get to have dinner with your bare hands while watching it. The show was great! something for kids and adults alike. The actors and actresses were keeping the people involved. Food was eaten with hands. Drinks were good prices. And Met some cool people next to us. Had a great time.

What a great show ,Can't wait to take my friends, non stop laughter, Great food. and service . First class all the way. When they say crowd participation they mean it..

This is a long-running dinner theatre in the old part of town and a very amusing way to spend an evening. The meal was only so-so but the entertainment was excellent and the price reasonable. Three murders occurred in the space of a couple of hours.

title: Parasol Up Parasol Down at Wynn Las Vegas, Las Vegas
address: 3131 Las Vegas Boulevard South, Las Vegas, NV
review_list:
We were staying at the MGM but we walked here pretty much everyday of our Vegas trip! One of the best bars I've ever been to especially in the middle of the day when the sun is out so you can just chill, watch the waterfall and have a few drinks. Staff were really friendly and hard working too. Hope...


More  



Classic Wynn styling....elegance with a dash of whimsy. The cocktails are uniquely made, accompanied with a dish of snack mix to nosh. Great area for people watching while plotting your next Vegas adventure!

This was our second time at the Parasol Up Bar at the Wynn. We had to come back for the great service and drinks and free light show at the waterfall. We always have a great time with the bartenders who are friendly and provide table side service as it was our own private party. Full bar, great outside view...


More  



My husband, friends and I spent a lovely afternoon outside on the patio at Parasol Up Parasol Down. There is no denying that this is a beautiful, luxury filled bar. Children are not allowed (a plus for any bar) and the cocktails are yummy. The price tag knocks it down a star. The average drink is in the $16-$20 range...


More  



I think the Parasol Up Parasol Down is my favorite element of the Wynn. These brightly colored parasols floating up and down in this large atrium are whimsical and colorful and just plain make me happy. I feel like I'm in Alice in Wonderland in this space, without all the drug overtones.
There are three bar areas, one inside and...


More  



We stopped for afternoon drinks. $45 for a cocktail, beer and espresso, not expensive considering the view, ambiance and excellent service. The waterfall feature was beautiful in the daytime, apparently fabulous with the evening lightshow which starts at 6pm. Will def visit here again.

The two bars are nice, sophisticated and expensive, but you are at the Wynn....
If there is room, choose Parasol Down, with a great view on the falling water. During peak hours, you may take long to get seated.

My husband and I stayed at the Wynn for our anniversary. We stopped-in to Parasol Up/Parasol Down for a drink. Watching the parasols go "up" and back down was a lovely but momentary enjoyment. We each ordered a drink - my mixed drink was $20!

What an amazing experience the food the ambiance everything that is important for a restaurant to be top notch you got here

We visited Parasol Up for a champagne toast on our anniversary. It was a pleasant visit with comfy couches. The service was quick and our waitress was helpful and attentive. I recommend this for couples, families would be out of sorts. Also, it was rather smoky as they accommodate cigar smokers.

title: House of Blues, Las Vegas

review_list:

We saw Carlos Santana perform in the music hall/ theater part of this establishment. It is wonderfully intimate and a great show

The band and the venue were great, but the ticket and drink prices were absurd. I'm glad we found discounted tickets on the strip! Enjoyed the music, had good bar food and really good drinks but the employees were very rude, standing in our way so we couldn't see the music. When I asked them to move I got harassed by a royal DB.

We saw Slash with Miles Kennedy and the Conspirators here on New Years Eve. This is all you think a gospel brunch would be and a whole ton of fun! The food was great! A wide variety of choices from waffles and chicken to meat carving station! Cajun food! Peel and eat shrimp!
The singers were just so much fun and boy can they sing!!! I felt the presents of the lord!!

What a fabulous way to end our trip...it was our last and one of our favorite shows.
Sunday....Gospel brunch!
Great performance, amazing vocals, impeccable bruch. They involved the audience with humor. And we made new friends at our table!
We would definitely go again!

We figured that the music would be great, but the food and the performers were equally outstanding. For buffet food, it was scrumptious. Cant' believe those performers have that much energy that early in the morning. Well worth the price!

David Guetta was the main event on Saturday when we went. The DJ before him was great and of course, David was amazing! This place, although pricey, is so worth it. There are really great vibes and I can honestly say it was my favourite thing that we attended while we were in Vegas.

Great vibe, excellent music and DJ's
Cocktails were expensive, but tasted great so cannot complain
A must to go to if you are in Vegas!

As the title states, we showed up for a Thursday night and realized that a special party was being held at what is normally only a day club. We dressed in beach attire as prescribed on the banner and walked into one of the funnest, coolest, night club experiences I've ever had. The music was pumping, but not too loud...

Great place for a little down time. Water feels cooler in Las Vegas due to the low humidity. Nice getaway.

My husband & I stayed at the Wynn last year during our honeymoon, & were very pleased with our stay. So we decided this year to try the Encore for a change (which btw is more expensive than Wynn). What a disappointment!
First of all, I prefer the rooms at the Wynn, spacier, cleaner-looking.

title: Scoot City Tours, Las Vegas
address: 3200 Polaris Ave., Las Vegas, NV 89102
review_list:
A brilliant way to get away from it all whilst in Las Vegas. A little pricey, but definitely worth it as far as we were concerned. Who wouldn't want to spend their birthday driving a giant M&M through the beauty of Red Rock Canyon. Highly recommend this to anyone who fancies doing something away from the Strip!

My husband and I were intrigued but hesitant particularly as we started the drive alongside cars. But the guides were terrific with a balance of stops to take pictures and particularly a description of the next leg. In the end we were having a great time and the red rock canyon sights and slightly windy road was the perfect backdrop....


More  



We had a great time! It was fun taking turns driving the cars and admiring the beautiful scenery. Highly recommended.

My boyfriend and I took the Red Rock Canyon tour. To start the morning I received a text from Johnny confirming our trip, time and advice on how to dress for the day. The van arrived to our hotel early. Our tour guide was awesome. Super friendly. Unfortunately for us it was pretty cold out. But luckily our guide came...

It got pretty darn cold late in the day, but overall it was an exhilarating blast of fun. We felt safe and protected in our little cars even driving through traffic. Both of our two tour guides were engaging and personable. The price is a little on the high side, but we both felt it was worth it.

My brother and me did this tour November 24th. Make time to do this ride.

This was a fun & informative tour. Kelly is very knowledgeable & a great tour guide. We enjoyed every minute of it, walked away amazed at what all we learned! HIGHLY recommend this tour to anyone, even locals!

Gave us great tips on where to go for dinner, gambling, shopping, etc. Showed us the rejuvenation of some areas that were recently sketchy but now are beautiful and very bohemian.

Tour guide REALLY knew his stuff -- was thoughtful, could answer a wide variety of questions, understood the complex interaction of factors on why/how things occurred. Really pleasant man. Sooooo much history!! The tour was fabulous! I learned so much about Fremont in such a small amount of time. My guide was so pleasant and made the tour fun! Happy I did the tour and would do it again! Way to go!

I have never enjoyed a tour more than this one. All the things that you see on the outside facade of Fremont Street, are not what appears behind. The Walking Tour was a great way to explore the older section of Vegas, which ended up being our favorite area. Kelly was a great guide!! This gallery is a must to see. The work of Richard MacDonald is nothing short of amazing and has to be experienced.

This artist is so talented, the sculptures are perfect in detail. Very interesting displays. Pleasing to view.

This is a small gallery right at the entrance of the O at the Bellagio. It's lovely art. They are all sculptures done by Richard MacDonald of the cast members in poses inspired by the show. They are beautifully done, and interesting to look at for a few minutes while you wait for the show. I'd say it's worth a...


More  



Very interesting & different - made a nice change in viewing.
But, you'll need deep pockets if purchasing!:)

We walked by while going to the Sports Book for some horse races so we stopped by for a brief visit. The gentleman working there was very friendly. It is amazing how much the small pieces cost. Definietly worth a stop if you are nearby.

If you love Cirque de Soliel, you really need to see this exhibit. It is Cirque in statuary. Absolutely beautiful!

Amazing work and fun to look at before O started. It's impressive what some people can do. Not on the one who made the poses but the sculptures themselves.

Pretty cool way to spend a couple minutes before the doors open for Cirque du Soleil's "O". The art is nice to look at and pretty expensive.

Richards sculptures are a study in the human form, sensuality, strength, and class. We loved walking through the gallery after "O" and looking at all of his amazing work. Every piece was just stunning.

title: Casino at Excalibur, Las Vegas

My son was impressed with the hotel and loved the idea of staying in a castle. Rooms were decent size and clean and updated, but I don't think we actually slept much. Location good on the strip too.

Not my favourite casino as it has none of the vegas luxury. However the games are all well priced and they offer lessons free of charge in most of the popular games.

We have been to Vegas several times and this was our first time staying at Excalibur. It's a more affordable hotel and it shows. The quality of this hotel was below others on the strip but the price was right for this trip. Its unfortunate they forgot to let us know that the pools were closed during our stay as...


More  



Cool themed hotel with reasonable prices, gambling was good compared to the other casinos in Vegas. Very nice staff, good restaurant choices and centrally located.

We (a couple) briefly visited Excalibur and wasn't impressed at by this casino.
Even that exterior looks awesome, the interior of the casino has nothing do do with its outside look. It is very old inside, and it is not because of King Arthur, but because it was built more than 25 years ago.

Casino is nice at best. Looks dated but had a good time. Hotel rooms lack refrigerator, coffee pot, and microwave. Room prices are good though and it is relatively clean.

If you like a good and a low cost hotel this is your hotel!!! Great rooms and a good staff. Use the outside parking lot.

The arcade was fun for my 4 year old daughter but overall the hotel looked very dated and the food choices were limited compared to newer casinos.

Nice enough casino located with access between net York New York and the Luxor. It is quite the walk to either of those casinos from this one so it is a good put stop. Only thing is we found it a little tricky to get to the casino since it's located on a lower level. Found some good black jack...

title: Mermaid's Casino, Las Vegas
address: 32 Fremont Street, Las Vegas, NV 89101
review_list:
I think one of their draws is the snack bar $1.50 hot dogs, $1.50 fries (generous) fried Twinkie and oh yes those little lumps of goodness smothered in powdered sugar known as the fried Oreo. They have a few hi-tops you can park at while you consume your chow.
As with most of the downtown properties the casino is a...


More  



Slots are easy, food is fun and the mermaids out front very friendly. Notice the signage.
Chocolate covered Banana's and Deep Fried Twinkies are my favorites.
$ .99 each!
other fun food. Snack bar always has a line-up and it is worth the 5 minutes.
No Players Rewards Cards programs result in low price food, easy gambling and great fun.

Recommended by a friend. Small casino right off Fremont Street. Get your deep fried fix at the counter in the back. Everything from Oreos to PB&J's can be had. Helps to soak up the alcohol that you are sure to consume

The Mermaid Casino is located on Fremont Street. It is small, slots only, but has a bar and sells Nathan's hot dogs. Two girls outside give you a string of beads and coupons. Fun little casino with music playing.

Very small / older casino. I recommend going in to get some deep fried Oreo's and Twinkies! They are amazing!

We stopped here on our day down at Freemont Street (we were staying on the Strip) and had a blast. The manager RJ and bartender Tara made our time down there really memorable. The chilli cheese dogs are delicious as well. Definitely need to stop there if you are down on Freemont!

A small casino but the place has some good food options. Always fun. They used to serve draft beer. Not sure if they still do?

We almost didn't go in here because it was so tiny, but we are happy we did. Don't let the exterior fool you! They have a great and cheap snack menu! We got deep fried oreos and a frozen chocolate covered Banana for 2 bucks total. Most of the items are 1.00-4.00. Yumm!

Great little casino, very bright and clean (not sure why some reviews say its dingy). Friendly staff and great place to get that deep fried snack. Drink service is fast and they take your order as soon as you walk in. No its not a fancy strip casino, but that's the point.... its a great little place to play slots,...


More  



Stop by with a group of 4 for the deep fried treats. The food was great and very inexpensive. Another unexpected find was the great drinks at the bar. Really enjoyed the place.

title: Casino at the Flamingo Las Vegas, Las Vegas
address: 3555 Las Vegas Boulevard South, Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
The Flamingo Casino was not crowded or smoky. I was very impressed with how quickly the drink waitresses would attend to you while you sat and gambled.

I have been visiting the Flamingo for many, many years. The people there are very friendly and helpful. If you stay there be sure to check out the awesome pool. It is great especially during the summer. Ask for a room facing the High Roller.

This casino is pretty fair as far as pricing, it's clean and feels safe/fun. I play here most times I visit Vegas, regardless of whether or not I'm staying here. Overall a pretty good vibe.

I have never stayed at the Flamingo, but walked down from the resort I was staying at to try some gambling. To my surprise it was the only casino that I actually won anything at.

We stay at Flamingo about once a month. The rooms are very comfortable and we always have excellent service in every area of our stay.

Centrally located. Good food, entertainment and gaming. The staff will support your every needs. Good luck at the tables!!

Went on sat. Afternoon variety of slots too play plus plenty of open table games. Cocktail servers were prompt and courteous

It was ok but would have liked to see cocktail waitresses come around more often and delivery of the beverages delivered in a more timely fashion.

If all the rooms at the Flamingo are like the one we had. Do not spend your money staying there. Go elsewhere.

I really enjoyed my time in the Flamingo and Harrah's casinos. There is a town to do there the strip between the two is fantastic and Margaritaville is a must visit at least once.

title: White Tiger Habitat at the Mirage, Las Vegas

review_list:

Went here this morning and it was amazing. To think that all this could be inside a hotel is amazing too. Enjoyed the dolphins most of all...such gorgeous animals. Would definitely recommend going here if your in the area.

The tigers are gorgeous. If you go around noon, they feed the two cubs which is adorable and a keeper is available to answer your questions. The dolphin exhibit is not all that flash. The dolphins dont do too many tricks but you can get closer to them than anywhere else I have been and that is quite a thrill

I enjoyed watching the dolphins which were great to see. There was a few different pools for them to swim around in and they seemed well looked after. The trainers were all very nice. After the dolphin habitat I made my way over to the White Tiger Habitat. I wish I didn't.
I was disgusted at how small the enclosures/cages...

I don't agree with captive animals for entertainment therefor I do not enjoy these exhibits or support them.

My husband and I felt this was the only thing worth paying for, and we were right! The dolphins are so elegant and entertaining, and the tigers, lions, etc. seem so happy and calm here. The babies loved to play! I highly recommend it!

The habitat at MGM Grand is grand as its name. The lions turn on the exhibit in the heart of the hotel. This was the first time visiting the habitat! It was very impressive and the employees were very informative about the tigers and dolphins. The dolphin show was awesome! The tickets prices were very reasonable and you could spend as much time as you wanted to in the habitats. Well worth the money!!!

We went around 11am in December. My kids enjoyed seeing the tiger cubs wrestle. There is not much room for the animals to move around. The lion was very active when we went.
Find and use the $5 off coupon on Mirage's website.

This was a perfect morning stop for families. My daughter loved watching the dolphins and tigers and best of all the trainers come out and work with the dolphins for about 45 minutes. Lots to do and see here. This lies between the Palazzo and the Venetian. Lots of high end boutique shops.

visited the casino for the $2 beer and play some wheel of fortune but the staff kept approaching to give a players card

title: Casino at Harrah's Las Vegas, Las Vegas
address: 3475 Las Vegas Blvd South, Las Vegas, NV 89109-8922
review_list:
Harrah's has a good variety of activities for most casino visitors. It has a very good mix of restaurants, shops, and gaming without being pretentious. While I don't particularly like crowded casinos, I can also appreciate that it is generally crowded because it has a lot to offer for most casino goers.

I took the shuttle from the Rio to the Harrah's with my party, We had a wonderful time at the slots. The selection of slot machines was great. Will definitely come back on our next visit to Vegas.

I won't mention the horrid design and outdated floor, but what stopped me from spending any extending period of time here was the perfume they sprayed out to hide the smell of smoke. It was over powering and rank, whoever made that decision needs to be sacked.

Have stayed overnight at this casino for years but added Resort Fees of $29.00 per night prohibits stays in this casino when there are better Comp choices available.

Harrah's offers just about anything you want to do or eat. Good place to go with friends. Good place to gamble.

Friendly, good dealers at the tables. Everyone seemed to be in a good mood and willing to help. Will visit again.

With the addition of Linq and its amenities, the harrahs part of strip has become more appealing. Lots of energy, reasonable table limits, and a very new and younger feel.

Horrible smell of sewer! Had to fight to get them to switch rooms! Slow elevators. New room was much nicer.

Fun Dealers..Good location.. Good place to play Black Jack..Bad experience with a server but Im thinking its a rare situation

Spent afternoon playing slots and ALL the employees that we came in contact with were very helpful and prompt. Enjoyed the slots and the atmosphere....

title: Spring Mountain Ranch State Park, Las Vegas
address: Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area, Las Vegas, NV 89004
review_list:
For the second time in three days we found that doing the popular trips around Las Vegas - over the holidays - in the afternoon - will amount to crazy traffic and wait times. Seeing the lineups for the Red Rock Canyon loop we bailed out of the lineup and went to Spring Mountain which proved to be an enjoyable...


More  



The ranch house is a really cute little place to poke around for a few minutes. Definitely allow them to show you the room that is roped off. There is a nice surprise in there! The walking trails were absolutely beautiful! The lake is a must see!

Plan to spend at least an hour touring the ranch house once owned by Vera Krupp, then Howard Hughes. You can almost hear the conversations of the rich and famous. Great trails and wonderful scenery!

This historic ranch is located at the base of the majestic Red rock mountains . Interesting history !

Historic ranch with small museum. Nice easy hikes in the surroundings (Ash Grove & Lake Harriet) with views on the Red Rocks. You can BBQ in the picnic area.

Situated in the historic Red Rock Canyon lies the Spring Mountain Ranch State Park. The house is the former home of the legendary Howard H. Hughes, at one time the wealthiest man in the world.
The house does docent-led tours, and in the summer time, outdoor theatre is presented at the ranch. Bring a blanket or a lawn chair. There...


More  



Just about 20 miles from either end of the Strip and in the opposite direction from Lake Mead (that means West) you get to drive through the beautiful Red Rock Canyon National Recreation Area. After you take the 13 mile (20km) scenic drive (US Natl Park Passes are accepted) with a stop at the children's Discovery trail to check out...


More  



Paid $7.00 for party of 2. Map given - not easily understood. Docents available on Friday and weekends.
Parking lot is easily found, sign to visitor center is hidden, and not easily seen. Cement walk way on left leads to picnic area. Uphill cement walkway leads to visitor center. There are 2 handicap parking at the visitor center.
To see...

Stop here on your Red Rock Canyon trip as it is really close. Good walk around property to lake, cool tour of house with history lesson..worth a two hour stop to entertain outside of Vegas rush, to slow down and see property that looks like its a Mirage in its Desert setting. 35 minutes from Vegas

This is Elizabeth Taylor's former home and one can view what this property looked like in the 1950s. Alas the horses and other livestock are gone, but it is a beautiful place to go and have a picnic.

title: Casino at the Hard Rock Hotel, Las Vegas
address: 4455 Paradise Road, Las Vegas, NV 89109
review_list:
Horrible location, small casino, dealers make mistakes constantly. The only positive to the place is that the Hofbrauhaus is across the street, so you can get a decent meal.

Had a great time at the casino and pink taco, great food great service. Thank you so much for making all 20 of us feel so welcome.

A medium size casino off the strip. No children, but lots of women. It was fun to sit and watch them go by. As for gambling they have all the ways of helping you to loose your money. Noisy and smokey.

Smaller casino by Vegas standards, but on weekend nights the pole dancers come out! I especially like the incredible memorabilia displayed all throughout the casino. And no kids in the hotel!

This is the same casino as all the rest! They are all smokey, all the games are the same as everywhere else, and the layout is the same as well. The only difference is the carpet.

Really liked this casino, although positioned off the strip it was really nicely laid out and had lots of other memorabilia scattered around for you to look at.
It was one of the more modern casinos with a good variety of machines and tables. The sports bar was a particular draw as it was nicely spread out and very modern.

Older casino and a little out of the way, but glad we saw it. They part of the hop on hop off bus route so easy enough to get to for a quick visit.

You never know who just may be seated at one of the tables there so be on the lookout for a celeb or 2 since it's a popular off strip destination.

Been going to Hard Rock Hotel since we first started visiting Las Vegas. The main bar is a great place to have a drink or two. They've renovated the casino a bit since my last visit in 2014.

They remodeled but the old stile was much better. Not many people even showed up for New Years 2016. That should tell you something. They removed the upper walkway and the pole dancers. The place used to be exiting. Not any more. go to the strip it's really a hell of a lot better.

title: O'Sheas, Las Vegas

great place to play the childhood game war...so fun and won a lot of money!!! inexpensive and can get a yard of margs near by... kinda a dive but great fun!

This is the place to visit if you enjoy a loud, party environment. Worth visiting just to watch the beer pong. Especially fun after midnight!

Kinda like pub ambiance. We went in here one evening and there was live entertainment. The entertainment was pretty good.

Big crowd, good music, lots of folks enjoying beer pong. Pretty cool that you can play blackjack right in the bar. Expensive drinks if you're not gambling, and if you are gambling the liquor selection is quite limited so don't expect top shelf brands. Lots of excitement. Will return.

Fun drinking spot with good drinks and beer pong. My friend really liked the frozen Baileys slurpies.

This place is a great environment for any age and any Vegas goer'...whether you want to kick back and play cards, get after a game of Beer Pong, listen to live music or whatever else. The manager, Little Brian, keeps things lively! Highly recommend it!

The remodel O'Shea's is a great place to gamble without nose-bleed table minimums, but even better than the gambling is Lindsey the bartender. She is attentive, efficient and engaging. Those of us from small towns, most likely, feel the most comfortable downtown. People don't "dress to impress" and are more genuine. Binion's offers that small town feel and every customer is treated equally.

While walking around Fremont Street stopped in at the casino in Binion's. My impression was it was on the dark side, but clean. There was some smoke in the air but not enough to want to make me leave. Enjoyed playing here.

In my opinion this casino is one of the nicer ones on Fremont. Plenty of games and a great poker room. Lots of historic pics to look at as well when you're there.

We hit Freemont Street with a group of around 30 people who were all there for a friends wedding. Binion's Casino was our favorite, by far. We enjoyed the many different restaurant selections and the cheap margaritas.

The casino is fun to hang out for a while, have a drink, people watch. The staff is very friendly.
And make sure to have your picture with 1 million dollars, they give it to you for free!!

Had a walk through the casino which looks tired and dated compared to others in the area, went to margaritaville bar, cocktails were sub standard frozen rubbish we couldn't even taste the tequila, maybe we went on a bad day but would be returning to try

title: The D Casino, Las Vegas

If you get to Fremont street, go upatairs at the D. they have some old school slots as well as a hore race game that is a lot of fun.

title: The Deuce, Las Vegas

review_list:
I highly recommend using the Deuce to travel the strip! It will cut out tons of time you would spend walking. It's especially useful when you're headed out to specific casinos/restaurants and don't want to dish out money for a taxi. The price is reasonable and it arrives every few minutes (although I wish it was more often).

This bus service travels the strip, north and south. It cost $8 for a 24 hour pass - much cheaper than cab fare. My husband & I never had to wait long for a bus to come. If the bottom is crowded, go upstairs & enjoy the view.

"It is relatively cheap, with a 2 hour pass for $6, a 24-hour pass for $8 or 3-day pass for $20. " My husband & I used this to travel up and down the strip as my husband has a bad knee. We hardly had to wait at all for the Deuce. If it's crowded downstairs, go upstairs and enjoy...

an easy way to travel between the strip and down town much much cheaper than a taxi with a fast efficient and friendly service, felt safe and secure

Go up to the Mob Museum or Freemont Street. Head all the way down to Mandalay Bay. Sit up top in the front and...


More  



Nice and economical way to travel the strip. Recommend purchasing the 24 hour ticket. Bus stops regularly. May be full so you need to go to the upper deck. Can take to Fremont Street. Hours of operation are great. Drivers are helpful.

This bus is the easiest way to get around Las Vegas. It is clean and safe. Many people on it are tourists.

If you're staying for a few days, it's best to get a bus pass! You'll definitely save a lot of money, and your feet from hurting! Buses come at decent times so you shouldn't have to wait too long for another one to come around.

Economical way to travel the strip. Get a 24 hour ticket. Go to Fremont St. Used by tourists and locals. It may be very crowded during the peak evening season.

The Las Vegas transit system is excellent, well organized and efficient. Unfortunately the prices have soared, the 'deuce' used to be $2 but is now $6! Still, a great way to get around - especially upstairs in the front on the right hand seats :-)

We took family photos at the park a few months back. Very peaceful spot with nice scenery.
I've also run some 5K races at this park so there are a few functions that go on here.
It's not mind blowing but it is a Vegas that most people don't expect.

title: Casino at Palace Station, Las Vegas
address: Las Vegas, NV
review_list:
This place has low table limits and the latest slots. It has a low ceiling so it is very smokey inside. The staff were very friendly. Nice sportsbook.

You can let your hair down, er it is okay if your pants are down at this place. Laid back locals staff it and patronize it. title: Vegas Vic, Las Vegas
address: Fremont Street, Las Vegas, NV
review_list:
My first time in Las Vegas was 1952 with my uncle and brother. I remember Vegas Vic as we stayed downtown. Downtown were it all was. Now almost 55 years later he still stands and greets folks on Fremont Street. When downtown say "howdy" to Vic.

Vic stands over Fremont street where the Freemont experience is located. He has been standing there since 1951. The sign currently is outside of a souvenir shop. If you were going for the experience, definitely see it. Otherwise, it is not worth making a separate trip for.

Iconic and a must see on Fremont Street. Get your pic with Vic. Don't forget to learn the history of this great attraction as well.

Wow, just old school Vegas, not worth the trip just for this but the whole experience - awesome. When on Fremont Street, look up!

Vegas Vic the cowboy greeting you at Fremont street used to mean Las Vegas to me as a kid. Of course when I first came to Vegas I saw the Vegas of the strip but going to Fremont Street and seeing Vegas Vic, I really felt that I had arrived.

This is one of my favorite things to do in all of Las Vegas. The casinos and all the signs around here are so iconic of what Vegas used to be like. This is definitely a very cool place to walk around at night when the signs are all light up!

The Vegas Vic cowboy neon sign will be familiar to anyone who has seen images of Vegas before The Strip started to take over in the eighties. Vic's a little sad now as his location on the exterior of the Pioneer Club has been covered by the light canopy of The Fremont Street Experience, but it's still a thrill to...


More  



This makes my think of the old Las Vegas you see in the movies before the strip really expanded. I hope they preserve him and leave him on Fremont street. I'm afraid he will end up at the Neon Museum and off Fremont Street.

it was kind of sad to see him looming over a ratty souvenir store. A lot of his neon is out, too. He's a landmark, an icon of another era and he should be maintained as such

title: Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints Las Vegas Temple, Las Vegas
address: 827 Temple View Drive, Las Vegas, NV 89110-2920
review_list:
It's a nice afternoon activity of your driving around the valley. You'll get great views of the strip and surrounding area. The temple is big. And just a nice piece of real estate to see.

A Mormon Temple in Sin City might seem a bit of a non sequitir but Las Vegas has always had a huge LDS population, dating back to pioneer days. The temple occupies a commanding spot on the side of Sunrise Mountain, east of the city. The grounds are lovely to visit, and the view up here is magnificent - especially...


More  



The views and the peaceful feeling while visiting the Las Vegas LDS Temple make a short drive there well worth it. You don't have to be a member to visit the temple grounds and recharge your spiritual batteries. This is a wonderful short side trip while in Vegas.

I wasn't sure if it was going to be worth the 2.5 hour drive to Las Vegas from St George just do spend 2 hours at the temple, but it definitely was. The temple is huge! I'm used to the smaller ones around my area. It was so beautiful inside as well. Parking was so accessible, it was easy to...


More  



I was so surprised to find such a serene location in Las Vegas. It has beautiful views of the strip as you drive towards the hills. We were there on a day with multiple weddings - it was beautiful to see how inspiring the temple is to these couples and families.

Walk the grounds with your family! Perfect for getting away from the strip a little especially if you have any age children on your trip with you . Easy access and beautiful views of the mountains up close also. A great way for the family to come together on vacation. A must see!

We had such a nice time walking around the grounds. We are LDS but didn't have time to go through a session. It was so nice to get away from the hustle of the city and just spend some time on the well-manicured grounds.

This is a very nice contrast to Las Vegas. It was the hi-light of our trip. Quiet, clean, and peaceful.

Grounds are splendid, well manicured and lush. Even though this is the high rent district, not many homes in the area have green grass! Tourists are invited to tour the grounds. They could use a visitors center, as this area was permanently settled by the LDS.

My experience was a very real and sacred one. They focused on Jesus Christ and the atonement, and the resurection. He lives now as he did then. Also that we can become better through Him and by Him. I loved it, and will go back.

title: Tule Springs Fossil Beds National Monument, Las Vegas
address: 4400 Horse Dr, Las Vegas, NV 89031
review_list:
I was so pleased to see the National Park Service establish a monument to protect the Tule Springs Archeological resources as a national monument, While it is now fenced to protect the geology of the area, it is about 100 years too late. This is a paleontologically significant area that has been extremely abused for decades. So while it is...


More  



Our group of four stepped into the past when we visited the Tule Springs Fossil Beds National Monument. New, without much signage. We stepped through an opening in the fencing, walked down a short path, then through ancient fossil beds. The 10-year-old was fascinated with what he saw and fantasized about whether space creatures would suddenly appear. Worth visiting if...


More  



Keep in mind folks that the site is still undeveloped and the major and bigger fossils have been removed. They wouldn't leave them out in the open for thieves. That said, I rate this by significance only which is highly important and significant to science and with the prospect of future development

The only accommodation for visitors is a few parking spaces. There is no sign. You have to climb a fence. I was told to walk 100 meters to the wash to see fossils. The only way to see whatever is worth seeing is to go with a guide from Protectors of Tule springs.

As the review is written, this national monument is only a few months old and not yet developed. That said, the findings there are of world importance. The area represents two ice ages and has numerous fossils and the Las Vegas poppy plant which is only found here!

title: Vista Cocktail Lounge, Las Vegas
address: 3570 South Las Vegas Blvd, Caesars Palace, Las Vegas, NV
review_list:
My daughter and I had drinks here. Nice atmosphere inside Caesar's. There a couple of big screen TV's off to side.

Really nice martinis and service, complete with perfectly dim lighting. Nice experience. The design made you feel as if you were away from the gambling even though the bar was open to the casino.

Agree with other reviewers bar tenders are amazingly slow and I can't think of a good reason to charge $18 for a gin/tonic or similar. Also could make a Mojito but not a Caprinha. Avoid.

Visited right before the Celine Dion show on 10/3/2015. Great ambiance! Feels like you've been transported to a top floor lounge in Manhattan via large LED screens on either side of the bar. If you're lucky, you'll get Tracy. She's awesome and made the best drinks. Prices not bad and pretty on par with most anywhere in Vegas.

We went an hour before going to see Celine Dion. It was incredibly stressful. It took half an hour to get our drinks, while it took others only ten minutes. 2-1 drinks, great music, good cocktails. The bartenders were friendly. They do close at 1am. Where ever you go inside Caesars Palace drinks are pricey. 2-1 good deal.

Screw this place. $18 plus tax for a single Jack Daniels. My wife's glass of wine ($10 bottle) was )$18 a glass Came to see Rod Stuart and have a drink before. The $$ for Vegas even is just stupid. Save your money for a place that won't screw you over.

A haven of calm sophistication in the gaudiness of Vegas. The Vista cocktail lounge boasts elegance and fabulous service from the experienced knowledgeable staff and truly the best Gin fizz you will ever experience. A must whilst passing through Caesars palace.
